item.title: Chess Journal
item.description: 7/10 If a defending King is chasing down a passed pawn the rule of the square is a shortcut to determine whether or not the King will be fast enough. If the King is able to enter the square there will be multiple routes to the pawn (the journey will contain a lateral/vertical move that can occur at any stage), unless the pawn stands on the opposite corner of the square to the pawnâ€™s promotion square. In this case the King still reaches the pawn, but must race straight down the diagonal. This is a good setup for the side with the pawn to look for an interference sacrifice, which would win a tempo and lead to promotion.
